body:
Comment 3 by **Joachim.Wuttke**: 
Co-existence of upper-case and "+" marking seems a particularly bad solution to me.

Is backward compatibility already a must in a language that is published as
"experimental" ? I understand there is already a lot of code you don't want to modify
line by line, but perhaps this could be done with a conversion script?

Is "+" the best choice? Why not use "@" or/and "$" to indicate visibility, as in Ruby?
